be.docarch.odt2braille
Class Odt2Daisy

java.lang.Object
  be.docarch.odt2braille.Odt2Daisy

public class Odt2Daisy
extends java.lang.Object

This class enables you to transform a flat .odt file to a DAISY-like xml file that is suited to be processed by liblouisxml. Note that, although it looks like a DAISY xml file, it is not, and would not validate. The actual transformation is done with XSLT. In addition to XSLT, Odt2Daisy also has a supporting preProcessing() method. Thanks to this preprocessing the XSL transform is considerably simplified. On the other hand, preProcessing is rather slow because it uses DOM (performance should be improved in the future).

Author:
Bert Frees
See Also:
DAISY xml specification

Odt2Daisy

public Odt2Daisy(java.io.File flatOdtFile,
                 Settings settings,
                 StatusIndicator statusIndicator,
                 java.util.Locale odtLocale,
                 java.util.Locale oooLocale)
          throws java.io.IOException
Creates a new Odt2Daisy instance.

Parameters:
flatOdtFile - The "flat XML" .odt file. This single file is the concatenation of all XML files in a normal .odt file.
settings - The braille Settings.
statusIndicator - The StatusIndicator that will be used.
odtLocale - The Locale for the document.
oooLocale - The Locale for the user interface.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

preProcessing

public void preProcessing()
                   throws javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException,
                          org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException,
                          javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
  • Special language tags,
  • page numbers,
  • list numbers, and
  • heading numbers
are added to the .odt file and some correction processing is done (see OdtUtils.correctionProcessing(java.lang.String)).

org.xml.sax.SAXException
java.io.IOException

insertPagination

private java.lang.Object[] insertPagination(org.w3c.dom.Node root,
                                            org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                            int pagenum,
                                            java.lang.String masterPageName,
                                            boolean isFirst)
                                     throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
Insert a special pagenum tag at the beginning of each page. This method is called recursively so that each document node is eventually processed once.

Parameters:
root - The root element of the .odt document.
node - The next node to be processed. On the first call, this parameter should be set to the first element of the document body. This first node plus all following siblings and their descendants will then be processed eventually.
pagenum - The number of the current page (should be set to zero on the first call).
masterPageName - The master-page name of the current page (should be set to "Standard" on the first call).
isFirst - Should be set to true on the first call.
Returns:
The updated [pagenum, masterPageName]. Most of the code was copied from com.versusoft.packages.jodl.OdtUtils (Vincent Spiewak), but several improvements were made.
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

insertHeadingNumbering

private void insertHeadingNumbering(org.w3c.dom.Node root,
                                    org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                    boolean init)
                             throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
Insert a special num tag before each numbered or bulleted heading. This method is called recursively so that each heading element is eventually processed once.

Parameters:
root - The root element of the .odt document.
node - The next node to be processed. On the first call, this parameter is irrelevant.
init - Should be set to true on the first call.
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

insertListNumbering

private void insertListNumbering(org.w3c.dom.Node root,
                                 org.w3c.dom.Node node,
                                 int level,
                                 boolean init)
                          throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
Insert a special num tag before each numbered or bulleted listitem. This method is called recursively so that each list is eventually processed once.

Parameters:
root - The root element of the .odt document.
node - The next node to be processed. On the first call, this parameter is irrelevant.
level - The level of the next node, being the number of ancestors of type list. On the first call, this parameter is irrelevant.
init - Should be set to true on the first call.
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException

convertAsDTBook

public boolean convertAsDTBook(java.lang.String daisyUrl,
                               boolean allVolumes,
                               int volumeNr,
                               Odt2Braille.VolumeType volumeType,
                               boolean body,
                               boolean front,
                               int beginPage,
                               int endPage,
                               int prelPages,
                               boolean[] specialSymbolsPresent,
                               boolean[] transcribersNotesEnabled)
                        throws javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException,
                               javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
Transform the (modified) flat .odt file to a DAISY-like xml file that is suited to be processed by liblouisxml. The transformation is done with XSLT.

Parameters:
daisyUrl - The URL of the output file.
allVolumes - If true, all volume bodies are processed. In this case, all other parameters are irrelevant.
volumeNr - The number of the volume (e.g. "1" for the preliminary volume, "5" for volume 5, "2" for supplement 2, etc.).
volumeType - The type of volume (Odt2Braille.VolumeType.NORMAL, Odt2Braille.VolumeType.PRELIMINARY or Odt2Braille.VolumeType.SUPPLEMENTARY).
body - If true, the volume body is processed.
front - If true, the preliminary section of the volume is processed. Folling parameters are only relevant when front is true.
beginPage - The first braille page number of the volume.
endPage - The last braille page number of the volume.
prelPages - The number of preliminary pages.
specialSymbolsPresent - An array containing booleans indicating which entries should be included in the special symbols list, in the order in which the corresponding Odt2Braille.SpecialSymbol values are declared. The array should have as much elements as there are values in Odt2Braille.SpecialSymbol. This parameter is irrelevant when volumeType is PRELIMINARY.
transcribersNotesEnabled - An array containing booleans indicating which entries should be included in the transcriber's notes page(s), in the order in which the corresponding Odt2Braille.TranscribersNote values are declared. The array should have as much elements as there are values in Odt2Braille.TranscribersNote. This parameter is irrelevant when volumeType is PRELIMINARY.
Returns:
true
Throws:
javax.xml.transform.TransformerConfigurationException
javax.xml.transform.TransformerException
